results.content:
First off, I want to say I received this course for free as a promotion.  I'm not affiliated with the instructor in any way, this free promo course I received is the first time I've ever heard of him.

I also want to say after taking the entire course (and watching one section - the longest - twice), it's obvious Rayan is a very smart and talented developer. There's no question about that.

There are a couple of issues I found with the course:

1) Too much CSS (though not a ton).  People are going to take this course because they're interested in React and Redux. I don't think people want to watch CSS being written in a React course. IMO, the HTML/CSS should have been all canned and the HTML referenced/copied/pasted to make into React components. It would have also helped if all the CSS parts were in separate videos where Rayan could have said "if you're not interested in CSS, just skip this video, this video only contains CSS". This would especially help when revisiting the sections in the future.

2) There is a bit of inconsistent code formatting/spacing/indentation, which looks sloppy and I personally find it mildly annoying.  This is a fairly trivial criticism and not everyone will really care. I just found it a little annoying, but I'm anal when it comes to code formatting.

3) I found the Redux section to be fairly confusing in parts.  This is the section I've watched 2x already and I'll go back and watch it again.  The first time, a lot of it made sense on the first pass, but it seems overly complex in its implementation.  I don't know if it wasn't explained well (and it's the longest section of the course) or my pea brain just isn't grasping it easily (probably more the latter).  To contrast this with Vue/Vuex, I found that very easy to reason about.  

I'll be seeking out other resources for Redux and afterwards will revisit the Redux section here. Hopefully it'll make much more sense for me at that point.

The Firebase section was interesting, I'm glad Rayan included that in this course.

I also like how Rayan pronounces "asynchronous" :)

results.content:
Coming from a C# development background with a little bit of html, css and js experience I wanted to learn ReactJS and how it is used. 

The functionality is explained well by the tutor and the ES6 crash course was a nice addition (although I still had to look up some syntax). After finishing this course I feel confident that I now understand and can implement ReactJS in my own future projects and maybe use it in a new work environment. The one thing I missed a little bit is an explanation on how to deploy the React.js website to a live website (unless it's just copying the folder to the hosting service and calling npm start). Also for people with no programming experience, I would recommend following a html, css and js course first because while the crash course did explain some basics, I'm pretty sure a total newcomer would be lost.

Nevertheless, this course helped me get started in one weekend, so big thanks to the tutor!

results.content:
I came into this course not knowing the first thing about react and most of my JS experience was with jQuery and simple vanilla JS in the past. I'm very experienced with HTML and CSS so those parts were a bit of a waste of time and was wishing that I could just easily skip past it.

The course touts itself as being a complete beginners guide (not expecting you to know much JS) so I figured I'd give it a shot with the great reviews it had. I wish I had taken a vanilla JS course before this though because a lot of the techniques, objects, methods, ES6 stuff was very foreign to me and were not explained very in depth by the instructor. 

I did enjoy learning how React works and am now exposed to the ultimate possibilities that this incredible framework is capable of. It's very obvious that Rayan has a passion for this and is extremely talented as a developer, but my novice skills hindered me too much to really grasp everything going on in this course. I fully expect to have to re-watch the course 2 or 3 times over to get a better understanding as well as watch other courses on JS in general to really cement my skillset.

I think that should be done more. Overall, a very good course and I will definitely be recommending it to others.

results.content:
So I completed this course and found it very useful. 
The course does what it promises. You get a good introduction to React and Redux. The instructor does a good job but there could be some improvements.
What's good :
- Lot of stuff in short time
- Good introduction
- Fun project to work on
- One big project instead of multiple small projects
- Price
- Calm voice

What could be improved
At the end of the course I got tired of the code errors. I understand it's not easy to talk and code, but going back to fix the errors again and again is time consuming. At one point I was saying to myself.. damn does he not see this... But besides that the coding was good.
The instructor talks in a calm voice, which is nice, but sometimes comes close to being boring but I know that is just personal taste.
The real issue for me is with the captions. I love Udemy courses and lot of them have their captions fixed and corrected. In this course the captions were hilarious. You should watch this course with captions on just to have a good laugh. For me captions are a big deal for others I guess not, but reading Jewish instead of JSX is not professional.
And for me personally... the instructor could tell a bit more about the packages used in this course like thunk. I found myself looking up some info first instead of just copying what the instructor told us. 

But... for the price paid I think this course was totally worth it. I already have an intermediate course waiting so the instructor really got me hooked on React. I look forward taking another of Rayan's classes.

Update 03/05 - Gave extra half star because Rayan was aware of the captions and it will get fixed. Responds to Q&A quickly which is also nice!

このコースではインスタグラム風のアプリを実装することができます。
まずコンポーネントの作り方、redux周りをトータルで学ぶことができるので良いと思いました。
bind(this)をしている箇所をarrow関数で書くこともできるので、色々なコースをやっている人からすると「こんな書き方もあるんだな」という学びもあって個人的にはよかったです。

redux周りのあたりをもう少し１コースの時間を短くして受講したかったというのが正直なところですが、とてもまとまっていて素晴らしいコースでした！
もっと素敵なコースをアップしてほしいと思います１
